instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message:
Ok here?s my finding 
1-new drive fresh install confirmed on another mac
2-replaced hdd cable 
3-checked connectors seem fine 

min looking around board for missing components. Any pointing in the right direction would help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message:
Boot USB OSX and check if internal HDD is recognized on Disk Utility.
Did you try an HDD with no APFS macOS installed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: Thank you sorry for the late reply. I put this board aside. To finish some other work.  The issue was with graphics. 1 Ram slot is also dead. I repaired some traces near the memory module freed some melted pins on memory slot and Still nothing. Bottom slot is not detected. I?m trying continuity between memory module and pin on the board. Also checking each slot connection to logic board from memory module.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: DDR3 tester card can show the lines with problems; usually broken solder/trace, corresponding LED stays off...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: Ok I?m gonna search ddr tester because I tested each line and they all have continuity. :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> question mark folder
threads.message: It?s a actual hardware or software ? I?ve seen the modules with the error codes is that what you mean?

Should I not have .75 at pin one of j2900? I?m sorry for the terrible images I drop this phone in the toilet :/
